metadata.synopsis: Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion, although he doesn't realise his quarry is standing in front of him.) At first Astarion thinks its funny to meet a monster hunter (as he's a monster) but turns sour when he discovers that he's the target.
metadata.how_to_trigger: repro steps:1. Start the game and proceed to the TUT level.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Using the debug book add Asterion as a companion.4. goto -26.208; 7.907; 238.965. Succeed the perception check (Shift-Q) or not6. Talk with Gandrel.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: What'll you do when you find him? Kill the vampire?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'm here to help. This is Astarion - the vampire you're hunting.

24.speaker: Gandrel
24.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*
53.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

89.speaker: Gandrel
89.text: Powdered iron-vine. An old hunter's trick - most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
89.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: You're a monster hunter? I'm surprised - I thought all Gur were vagrant cut-throats.
28.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

68.speaker: Player
68.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

152.speaker: Gandrel
152.text: And more! We steal chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters - the list goes on.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Pardon, but who - or what - is a Gur?
100.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

130.speaker: Gandrel
130.text: A mystical and dangerous people, we travel the land, never settling in one place.
130.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

115.speaker: Gandrel
115.text: We steal your chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters - your friend here has heard it all, I'm sure.
115.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

71.speaker: Gandrel
71.text: I wish I had half the power settled folk think my people possess. Alas, I am a simple wanderer.
71.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

92.speaker: Gandrel
92.text: A simple wanderer and monster hunter. But I'm no witchdoctor or cut-throat.
92.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I assume you want to kill the hag?

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: Or to make a deal with her. Probably think you can outfox the old dear.

99.speaker: Gandrel
99.text: Right, but very wrong. My prey is a vampire spawn - much less impressive than the beast that lives here.

48.speaker: Gandrel
48.text: I fear he's gone to ground. I hope the hag of these lands can help me flush him out, if I can afford her blood price.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Astarion here, he should visually react to the news that he's being hunted.NodeContext: The hag's 'blood price' is likely to be something that'll cost him dearly.

127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

58.speaker: Astarion
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

118.speaker: Player
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

73.speaker: Gandrel
73.text: It is a sacred mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast and return it to her.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

27.speaker: Astarion
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

50.speaker: Gandrel
50.text: Baldur's Gate. My people wait for me there.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

42.speaker: Player
42.text: *Under all the smiles, you can feel Astarion's tension. He's coiled like a spring, hand inching towards his weapon.*
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

98.speaker: Gandrel
98.text: *Under all the smiles, you can feel Astarion's tension. He's coiled like a spring, hand inching towards his weapon.*
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *Under all the smiles, you can feel Astarion's tension. He's coiled like a spring, hand inching towards his weapon.*
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Cough and give Astarion a warning look.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

113.speaker: Gandrel
113.text: Is your friend ill? I have some tea that might help...
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

141.speaker: Astarion
141.context: NodeContext: Coming back to yourself. You've been thinking about killing this guy, but the player has subtly warned you not to.

31.text: How do you capture a vampire, exactly?
31.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: How do you capture a vampire, exactly?
21.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

109.speaker: Gandrel
109.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

56.speaker: Gandrel
56.text: Beyond that, I will say no more. There are some trade secrets we cannot share.
56.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: We should go, but you have fun tracking your monster.
36.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Why not join us? We could use a monster hunter.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: No! I mean - we have different quests. I wouldn't want to distract this fellow from his path any more than he'd want to lead us from ours.

154.speaker: Gandrel
154.text: The elf is right. I have my own road to walk.

145.speaker: Gandrel
145.text: A more difficult road, now that the hag is gone, but perhaps a better one.

158.speaker: Gandrel
158.text: But I wish you well. Be safe.

0.speaker: Gandrel
0.text: A road that leads me straight to a hag's den, alas. But I wish you well. Be safe.

165.speaker: Gandrel
165.text: Thank you. Treating with a hag, I need all the luck I can get.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: [To Astarion] You're asking a lot of questions.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls the dagger loose and lets the corpse fall to the floor.NodeContext: You've just stabbed your nemesis in the eye with a dagger. You pull it loose as he slumps to the floor. This line follows on from 'I've crossed paths with his people before' -> (stabbing) -> it wasn't a good experience.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls the dagger loose and lets the corpse fall to the floor.NodeContext: You've just stabbed your nemesis in the eye with a dagger. You pull it loose as he slumps to the floor. This line follows on from 'I've crossed paths with his people before' -> (stabbing) -> it wasn't a good experience.

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: I've crossed paths with your people before, you know.
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls the dagger loose and lets the corpse fall to the floor.NodeContext: You've just stabbed your nemesis in the eye with a dagger. You pull it loose as he slumps to the floor. This line follows on from 'I've crossed paths with his people before' -> (stabbing) -> it wasn't a good experience.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls the dagger loose and lets the corpse fall to the floor.NodeContext: You've just stabbed your nemesis in the eye with a dagger. You pull it loose as he slumps to the floor. This line follows on from 'I've crossed paths with his people before' -> (stabbing) -> it wasn't a good experience.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: What the hells? He could have helped us!
55.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

86.speaker: Astarion
86.text: The Gur help themselves, no one else. Whatever his price, it would've been too much.
86.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: Trust me, I did us a favour.
90.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

142.speaker: Player
142.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: It's a figure of speech, darling. I'd be disappointed if you trusted me at all.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: You killed him because you're bigoted against his people?
84.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

41.speaker: Astarion
41.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: No. No, we're done here. Let's go.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: What favour, exactly? He didn't need to die.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: I had my reasons, you can be sure of that.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: Now, if we're done, we have more important business to get on with.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Next time, warn me before you murder someone.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: I absolutely, definitely will think about it.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: ...Tell me you had a good reason for that.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: He was spinning a tale, and you were falling for it. Vampires? Sacred missions? Honestly.

139.speaker: Astarion
139.text: He would've followed us to camp and slit our throats in the night.

162.speaker: Astarion
162.text: Let's go, we've wasted enough time talking.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: You're asking why a monster hunter would hunt a monster?

62.speaker: Gandrel
62.text: Just so. Vampires are godless parasites - we do not need a reason to destroy them.

96.speaker: Gandrel
96.text: But in this case, it is a sacred mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast and return it to her.

134.speaker: Astarion
134.text: Yes, yes, fine. It's just - specific. Why not kill the gnolls or goblins rampaging around here?

140.speaker: Gandrel
140.text: I fear he's gone to ground. I hoped the hag of these lands could help me flush him out, but it seems she is no more.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Astarion here, he should visually react to the news that he's being hunted.

38.speaker: Gandrel
38.text: His name is Astarion, but I fear he's gone to ground. I hope the hag of these lands can help me flush him out, if I can afford her blood price.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player exchange a lookNodeContext: The hag's 'blood price' is likely to be something that'll cost him dearly.

143.text: And when you find this 'Astarion'? You'll kill him?
143.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: And when you find this 'Astarion'? You'll kill him?
40.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

117.speaker: Gandrel
117.text: Not this time. My orders are to capture him.

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: Oh? And bring him where, exactly?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Only a spawn? Pity. Not like it's a real vampire.
103.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: I don't know. I'm sure a vampire spawn could still rip your throat out if he felt like it.
155.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

101.speaker: Gandrel
101.text: He is right, unfortunately. They are only weak when compared to their masters.
101.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

121.speaker: Gandrel
121.text: During the day, we have the advantage. But at night, when they hunt? You will not find a more deadly quarry.
121.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Yes, I'm sure they can creep right up on you.
133.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: We've all survived so far. Let's focus on that.
107.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

129.speaker: Gandrel
129.text: It would still be wise to post guards at night. The threat is real.
129.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: Indeed it is. We should do something about this threat.
128.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: All right, kill him if you must.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: We'll be careful, but we should get going.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Interesting. Astarion, what do you think?
11.context: NodeContext: You're looking at your vampire prey, standing in the sun

69.speaker: Gandrel
69.context: NodeContext: You're looking at your vampire prey, standing in the sun

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: These days, I'm making the impossible look easy.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: To player - he's asking permission to kill the Gur hunter, and he's very keen.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: To player - he's asking permission to kill the Gur hunter, and he's very keen.

106.speaker: Player
106.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

157.speaker: Gandrel
157.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: No, we're going to leave in peace.

156.speaker: Gandrel
156.text: Please do. But the vampire spawn is staying with me.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Don't do this. No one needs to die.
166.context: NodeContext: This line leads to combat.

57.speaker: Gandrel
57.context: NodeContext: This line leads to combat.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Well, I tried. Astarion? Kill the hunter.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Thank you for the warning, we'll be careful.
94.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

1.speaker: Gandrel
1.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

148.speaker: Astarion
148.text: Wait - that's it? We're just walking away?
148.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: Don't you think we should do something about the... vampire issue?
126.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I said we'll be careful. Now let's go.
45.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: Fine. But if this comes back to bite us, it's on your head.
74.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

159.speaker: Gandrel
159.text: Go in peace, my friends. I pray our paths cross again.
159.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

167.speaker: Astarion
167.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

47.speaker: Player
47.context: NodeContext: Said with hunger - you've just been given permission to kill someone you hate

78.speaker: Astarion
78.context: NodeContext: Said with hunger - you've just been given permission to kill someone you hate

70.speaker: Gandrel
70.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Fine. This is Astarion, the vampire spawn you're hunting.
163.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun.

6.speaker: Gandrel
6.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: You idiot. What have you done?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I've delivered a monster to a monster hunter.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.

137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.

26.speaker: Gandrel
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over the unconcious body of Astarion.

72.speaker: Gandrel
72.text: I thank you for your help. My people work to rid this world of evil - you are a friend to our cause.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

4.speaker: Player
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

13.speaker: Gandrel
13.text: It's amazing you survived, travelling with a beast like that.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

146.speaker: Gandrel
146.text: I have a cage ready nearby - it will hold him when he wakes.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

79.speaker: Gandrel
79.text: Thank you for this. And for cleansing this swamp of the hag. You have done good here today. Safe travels.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

77.speaker: Gandrel
77.text: I would have made a deal with the hag to find this. I'm very glad that I did not. Thank you and safe travels.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

29.speaker: Gandrel
29.text: I'll return him to my tribe, as ordered. Whatever fate awaits him there, I'm sure it is deserved.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Take the spawn, just leave his stuff with me.

67.speaker: Gandrel
67.text: It's yours. This is the only prize I need.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Relax, he's not taking you anywhere.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Time for us to go! Good luck with your quest.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Well, here he is. This is Astarion.

97.speaker: Gandrel
97.text: His name is Astarion, but I fear he's gone to ground. I was hoping the hag of these lands could help me flush him out, but it seems she is no more.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player exchange a look

122.speaker: Player
122.text: So what monster are you hunting?
122.context: NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: Something terrifying, no doubt. Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?
66.context: NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

164.speaker: Gandrel
164.text: Nothing so dramatic. I'm hunting for a vampire spawn.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: If I were a cut-throat, I wouldn't admit it either.

5.speaker: Gandrel
5.text: True. And I have no proof to offer but my word.

111.speaker: Gandrel
111.text: If you wish it, our paths need not cross again. I'm hunting a vampire spawn, and it is a little too bright for you to be my prey.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I knew you were a jackass, but a racist? I'm shocked.

153.speaker: Gandrel
153.text: Your friend has just heard the rumours of my people. That we steal chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters...

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Be nice, Astarion. Gandrel here has been looking for you.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Ignore the elf. He talks too much.

149.speaker: Gandrel
149.text: You should listen to your companion. Next he'll warn you that my people can curse your cow to give only sour milk and will seduce your daughter to a life of roaming.

125.speaker: Gandrel
125.text: You've tracked me down again, my friend. Would that I had as much luck with the beast I'm hunting.
